title: Every Nat is Even or Odd
description:
Prove that every natural number is either even or odd. We define even and odd using modular arithmetic.

**Goal:** `forall n : nat, Nat.even n = true \/ Nat.odd n = true`

Recall that `Nat.odd n` is defined as `negb (Nat.even n)`, so exactly one of `Nat.even n` and `Nat.odd n` is true.
hints: Use `intros n` then `destruct (Nat.even n) eqn:E` to case-split
When `Nat.even n = true`, use `left` and your hypothesis
When `Nat.even n = false`, use `right` and unfold `Nat.odd` / rewrite with E

Require Import Arith.
Require Import PeanoNat.
Require Import Bool.

solution:
Theorem even_odd_dec : forall n : nat,
  Nat.even n = true \/ Nat.odd n = true.
Proof.
  intros n.
  destruct (Nat.even n) eqn:E.
  - left. exact E.
  - right. unfold Nat.odd. rewrite E. simpl. reflexivity.
Qed.
